{{cpp/title|islower}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cctype|
int islower( int ch );
}}

Checks if the given character is classified as a lowercase character according to the current C locale. In the default {{c|"C"}} locale, {{tt|std::islower}} returns a nonzero value only for the lowercase letters ({{tt|abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz}}).

If {{tt|islower}} returns a nonzero value, it is guaranteed that {{lc|std::iscntrl}}, {{lc|std::isdigit}}, {{lc|std::ispunct}}, and {{lc|std::isspace}} return zero for the same character in the same C locale.

The behavior is undefined if the value of {{c|ch}} is not representable as {{c/core|unsigned char}} and is not equal to {{c|EOF}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character to classify}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Non-zero value if the character is a lowercase letter, zero otherwise.

===Notes===
{{cpp/string/byte/note unsigned char}}

===Example===
{{example|
|code=
#include &lt;cctype&gt;
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
int main()
{
    unsigned char c = '\xe5'; // letter Ã¥ in ISO-8859-1
 
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "islower(\'\\xe5\', default C locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; (bool)std::islower(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';
 
    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_GB.iso88591");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "islower(\'\\xe5\', ISO-8859-1 locale) returned "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; (bool)std::islower(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';

}
|p=true
|output=
islower('\xe5', default C locale) returned false
islower('\xe5', ISO-8859-1 locale) returned true
}}
